result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carol M. Hart

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM Defendant Carol M. Hart in court.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Carol M. Hart.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  DE in vivitrol program. State requires proof of programming. Offer made. Adjmt granted.  PLEAS 12/1 1:30pm. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Carol M. Hart
Current: LKA 4826 17th Avenue, Upper, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2022)
Prior: 4826 17th Avenue, Upper, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States
Notice of assignment of judge returned.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Signature bond email to the jail

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Edward C.   Strict compliance with vivitrol program.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Olson.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE accepted into vivitrol program.  Adjmt granted to determine if DE successful. FPT 10/19 930am. Request to modify bond to SB.  No objection by state.  Granted. Bond modified to $1000 SB. Prior conditions continued and including strict compliance with Vivitrol Program.

Defendant Carol M. Hart appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Edward C.

  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 5/4/22 @ 945am.   Motion to modify bond, arugments heard, court modifies to $250 cash bond w/ conditions as previosuly set.   jk

09:00 AM Defendant Carol M. Hart in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
